item.title: The .gitignore file
item.description: The .gitignore file This file allows to ignore/untrack the specified files and folders. To creates a .gitignore file, open you prefered text editor and saves a new file with the name .gitignore into the folder to be tracked by Git. To ignoring files/folders, do write the following comands in the .gitignore file previously created: Ignoring a folder Starts the line writing * followed by / and then the name of the folder to be ignored.
